lsr.concurrence.webserver
Class StaticSite

java.lang.Object
  lsr.concurrence.webserver.StaticSite

public final class StaticSite
extends java.lang.Object

Replies to HTTP requests, retrieving the resources requested from a local directory.

This class can be used in conjunction with HttpRequestStream to implement the main loop of a simple web server, as shown below: 

  Socket socket = ...  
  InputStream is = socket.getInputStream(); 
  PrintStream writer = new PrintStream(socket.getOutputStream());
  HttpRequestStream httpStream = new HttpRequestStream(is);
  while (true) {
    HttpRequest request = httpStream.readRequest();
    HttpResponse response = server.respondTo(request);
    response.writeTo(writer); 
  }

Instances of this class are thread-safe.

Author:
LSR

Method Detail

respondTo

public HttpResponse respondTo(HttpRequest request)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.net.URISyntaxException
Replies to an HttpRequest, by retrieving the resource from the site root directory.

Parameters:
request - The request to be processed.
Returns:
The response containing the file read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If reading the requested resource from disk fails.
java.net.URISyntaxException - If the request is malformed.
